rationales.self_direction: Santiago has spent years learning to give clients exactly what they ask for rather than pursuing his own artistic vision, admitting he doesn't know how to make bold work anymore.
rationales.stimulation: He followed brand guidelines perfectly and is confused by the demand for something 'bolder,' revealing his settled approach of delivering predictable, safe work.
rationales.power: He lost the Grupo Modelo commission to Fernanda despite six prior projects, a clear loss of standing and influence with a key client.
rationales.security: His proposal 'fit their brand guidelines perfectly' -- he prioritized safety and predictability in his approach to the commission.
rationales.conformity: He built his career producing exactly what clients request, conforming to briefs and expectations rather than challenging them.

rationales.self_direction: He has a blank canvas stretched for three months with an idea he never pursued because commissions consume all his time -- his personal creative vision is abandoned.
rationales.stimulation: He hasn't had time for anything beyond already-sold commissions, staying in a predictable cycle of client work with no room for creative exploration.
rationales.achievement: He listed his credentials to his mother unprompted -- the board position, studio space, and clients -- treating them as evidence of professional success.
rationales.power: He defended his status by citing his board position at the collective and the prestige of his clients, actively maintaining his social standing in the family comparison.
rationales.security: His studio is 'paid for by reliable commissions from architects and interior designers,' and he's built a stable, predictable career path.
rationales.conformity: He found himself defending his career to his mother even without being attacked, performing the role of successful provider his father would have expected.
rationales.tradition: His father's voice about respectability and providing for family drives his choices; he carries his father's expectations even though he chose art over business.
